subject: Re: Noob question re Kernel update and iptables
body:
Kernel 2.6.18-4-686 
1.  Is there a good link on compiling the kernel? 
2.  What is a module?
3.  How do you compile it with iptables?
4.  Is that what I need to do is recompile the kernel?

error:
iptables v1.3.6: can't initialize iptables table `nat': Permission denied (you must be root)
Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.
iptables v1.3.6: can't initialize iptables table `nat': Permission denied (you must be root)
Perhaps iptables or your kernel needs to be upgraded.

I am in root.. So what is the problem?

Thanks, frank


--- Paolo  wrote:

> On Sat, May 12, 2007 at 11:06:03AM -0700, Frank Parker wrote:
> >    I got an update notice to update my kernel
> >    I updated it.
> 
> to which version? (try 'uname -r')
> 
> >    Now i get the error:
> >    iptables v1.3.6 can't initialize iptables table 'nat'  etc......
> 
> you need to provide more infos, eg report a few msg lines before and after
> such msg - copy-paste as they are; that 'etc...' might tell something more.
> 
> --
> paolo
> 
>
